intro: Lundia nitidula, commonly known as the slender lantana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna or woodland habitats. Lundia nitidula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
